snippet.title: Well...You Said We Need to Insulate our Van - Van Makeover E06
snippet.description:
We got insulation for our van.  Lots of it in fact.  W bought a 30 meter roll of polyester microfiber matting.  It's similar to the insulation we used before.  But our last stuff was more dense and specifically made to use as insulation.  We were not able to get a hold of that here in Morocco so we found the closets alternative.  We found this stuff at a factory that supplies the bedding industry.  They also use this to fill sleeping bags. 

In case you were wondering why we don't go with a more traditional van build insulation such as fiberglass, rockwool, or foam board.  Well, as for fiberglass or mineral fiber, Lucy has a really bad reaction to that stuff.  And foam board is way too stiff to insert into all the round surfaces of our van.  Anyways, we used polyester microfiber for years and love the stuff.  It works great and even after years of use, was in perfect condition.

snippet.title: Video Shows Missouri Police Chief Allegedly 'Hammered Drunk,' Failing Sobriety Tests
snippet.description:
The O'Fallon Police Department in Missouri released bodycam footage showing a traffic stop of Hazelwood, Missouri Police Chief Gregg Hall who was suspected of driving while intoxicated on May 28. Officers performed multiple sobriety tests on Hall, all of which he "visibly failed," police say. The officer that performed the tests used the term "hammer drunk" to describe Hall during the incident. Hall was not arrested and was driven home by another police chief.

We mocked up the high roof for our van today.  And to be honest, it doesn’t blow our minds or anything.  And our plans to top the new high roof with our old roof doesn’t seem so smart for the van build.  So we need to come up with a new plan.  

If your just joining us, we are in Morocco to build a DIY high top for our van Tubi.  After over 3 years on the road, we are tired of hunched over van life.  We still have a long journey ahead so we’re chopping of the roof of our van and building a high top tall enough so we can finally stand in our van.

snippet.title: Wrapping-up what was a Tough Year in VAN LIFE
snippet.description:
Hi everyone.  This is a really short video I wanted to share at the end of 2021 and the start of 2022.  Van life came to a standstill for most of us.  Some of our friends packed it up and went home, not being able to finish their journey.  But somehow we were able to stay on the road.  And we even found some adventure along the way.  Not to mention finally making it back to Morocco and starting our van build.  But most importantly, we had a lot of support from family, friends, and all of you.  So hope you enjoy this video and thank you for everything.

snippet.title: Huge Disappointment - Vanlife in Morocco
snippet.description:
The famous van valley, or van heaven in Tafroute, Morocco is high on everyone's to-go list when driving through Morocco.  Last time we were here, there were hundreds of vanlifers, overlanders and RVers.  They were of all ages and came from all over the world.  It was full of energy and life.  There was a bustling economy that relied heavily on the vagabond visitors.  But now it's beautiful but lonely piece of the desert.

snippet.title: Should I Give Up? It's All Going Wrong at the Same Time...
snippet.description:
Van life is usually awesome.  But sometimes it's not.  This week was maybe the worst week we've had, with the exception of getting robbed maybe.  Anyways, it's not just one thing.  It's so many things.  It started with going in front of a Moroccan judge.  Then the hottest day ever, and I mean as long as both Mark and I have lived.  Then our tire melting and almost causing a real disaster.  And then finally, a strike all the way in Germany that cancelled my tickets back home.  What a week!

snippet.title: After 4 Years of Full-time Van Life Together, She's Leaving Me...
snippet.description:
Well, for most of you, this won't be a huge surprise.  Lucy's grandma is ill and she need to get back home urgently.  But this is quite a big deal for the two of us.  After 4 wonderful years of living and traveling in a van together, we say goodbye for the first time.  We don't know when she can come back.  It maybe a month, it maybe much longer.  Who knows what the future holds for us.  But for now, it's solo van life.

snippet.title: DIY High Top Not Looking Great So Starting Over From Scratch | Tubi 2.0 Van Build E03
snippet.description:
We mocked up the high roof for our van today.  And to be honest, it doesn’t blow our minds or anything.  And our plans to top the new high roof with our old roof doesn’t seem so smart for the van build.  So we need to come up with a new plan.  

If your just joining us, we are in Morocco to build a DIY high top for our van Tubi.  After over 3 years on the road, we are tired of hunched over van life.  We still have a long journey ahead so we’re chopping of the roof of our van and building a high top tall enough so we can finally stand in our van.

snippet.title: Huge Disappointment - Vanlife in Morocco
snippet.description:
The famous van valley, or van heaven in Tafroute, Morocco is high on everyone's to-go list when driving through Morocco.  Last time we were here, there were hundreds of vanlifers, overlanders and RVers.  They were of all ages and came from all over the world.  It was full of energy and life.  There was a bustling economy that relied heavily on the vagabond visitors.  But now it's beautiful but lonely piece of the desert.

snippet.title: Should I Give Up? It's All Going Wrong at the Same Time...
snippet.description:
Van life is usually awesome.  But sometimes it's not.  This week was maybe the worst week we've had, with the exception of getting robbed maybe.  Anyways, it's not just one thing.  It's so many things.  It started with going in front of a Moroccan judge.  Then the hottest day ever, and I mean as long as both Mark and I have lived.  Then our tire melting and almost causing a real disaster.  And then finally, a strike all the way in Germany that cancelled my tickets back home.  What a week!

snippet.title: After 4 Years of Full-time Van Life Together, She's Leaving Me...
snippet.description:
Well, for most of you, this won't be a huge surprise.  Lucy's grandma is ill and she need to get back home urgently.  But this is quite a big deal for the two of us.  After 4 wonderful years of living and traveling in a van together, we say goodbye for the first time.  We don't know when she can come back.  It maybe a month, it maybe much longer.  Who knows what the future holds for us.  But for now, it's solo van life.

snippet.title: Van Life in Italy | Amazing Mountain Top Village
snippet.description:
We make our way Gambatesa, a beautiful village in the Apennine mountains of central Italy to enjoy the weekly outdoor market, and take advantage of their free motorhome park that has everything we need.  Even though our van was made for off grid van life, we sometimes run into a long run of bad weather.  And we find the need to plug in to shore power.  Thankfully, italy has no shortage of free campsites that offer electricity for free.  Gambatesa has one of those campgrounds.  But it's on a steep mountain side.  And our navigation decided to take us the hard way up.

snippet.title: The Reality of Living in a Van (Unfiltered Version)
snippet.description:
Vanlife is mostly memorable and rewarding.  But living in a van isn't always like what you see on Instagram.  Although there are plenty of those moments too.  But most of the time, we are simply living our lives just like anyone else.  We have work and chores to do.  The main difference is that our home is our tiny van.  And then there are the challenges of always travelling on roads that are new to us.  Well, you'll soon find out what van life can really be like in this video.

snippet.title: 😰 Engine Problems So it's Back to Korea - Van Life in Europe E23
snippet.description:
Having a Korean van on the road has some unique problems, especially when it's a van that was only produced for a year and was only exported to two countries, Brazil and Australia. Our friend BJ has a Ssangyong Musso which is not as rare in Korea, but also difficult to find outside of Korea.  So he also know the pain of trying to get repairs.

snippet.title: How We Shower in Public Places | and Montese, Italy  - Van Life in Europe E24
snippet.description:
Living in a tiny van doesn't mean we can't have a giant shower.  Normally we put up the back hatch and hang a shower curtain, but that makes it obvious that we are taking a shower.  Not a problem when your out in the woods by yourself.  But often van life takes you to places a little more public, so we came up with this idea using our awning hide what's going on behind the tarps.  

We also take a look at Montese, Italy.  It's become one of our favorite stops on this trip.  It's a hidden city high on the top of a mountain.  It has a rich history and really kind town folk that know how to welcome visitors.

snippet.title: Christmas and New Years Cancelled - 2020 Pandemic Van Life Comes to a Bitter End
snippet.description:
2020 Vanlife started with so much to look forward to.  We planned to rebuild our van with a new high top and brand new interior.  We even bought everything we needed for the build like a roof fan and a large water tank.  We were so excited to get started.  But just as we bought the last components for our van build at the end of February, the pandemic hit and we were locked down in France.  Since then we have been just barely able to stay with our van.  It's been quite the year.  Now that 2021 is just around the corner, we are planning for things to get back to normal, or at least what ever the new normal looks like.  We thank everyone who stuck with us this year.  And we hope you have a safe, healthy and happy 2021.

snippet.title: Christmas and New Years Cancelled - 2020 Pandemic Van Life Comes to a Bitter End
snippet.description:
2020 Vanlife started with so much to look forward to.  We planned to rebuild our van with a new high top and brand new interior.  We even bought everything we needed for the build like a roof fan and a large water tank.  We were so excited to get started.  But just as we bought the last components for our van build at the end of February, the pandemic hit and we were locked down in France.  Since then we have been just barely able to stay with our van.  It's been quite the year.  Now that 2021 is just around the corner, we are planning for things to get back to normal, or at least what ever the new normal looks like.  We thank everyone who stuck with us this year.  And we hope you have a safe, healthy and happy 2021.

snippet.title: VANLIFE Drove 10k Miles Korea to Finland - Van Life Europe E01
snippet.description:
Our van life adventure started at the ferry terminal in Donghae, South Korea.  We boarded with our campervan Tubi and made our way 500 miles to Vladivostok, Russia.  Drove through the rough roads of Siberia, survived dust storms in the Mongolian Gobi desert, had a fender bender in Moscow and now we are finally in Europe.  Along the way we had three flat tires (two flats unrepairable), changed our suspension, and saw smoke blow out of our hood.  But it was all worth the effort.  The experiences we had, and the friendships we made are truly priceless.  But we always had our eyes set on Europe.  We just didn't know it would take us over 10,000 miles and 3 months to get there.

snippet.title: Vanlife enters the ARCTIC CIRCLE (Christmas Edition) - Van Life Europe E06
snippet.description:
In this episode we are in halfway up the middle of Finland, passing some of the beautiful lakes that dot the country side.  Along the way we park the van and enjoy one of the lakes as we make our meal outside even though the weather is getting colder the further we continue north.  We also stop by Santa Claus village to see Santa.  But the biggest thrill for us was crossing the Arctic Circle.  That was a first for both of us and it's something we won't forget.

snippet.title: Surviving an Arctic Storm at North Cape, Norway - Van Life Europe E08
snippet.description:
In this Van Life Europe episode we move from the true most northern point of Europe, to the the more accessible  North Cape frequented by tourists.  While we aren't much for touristy places, the views are really spectacular from the high cliffs that make up North Cape.  

But living in a van can be hard when it's cold outside, but throw in hurricane force winds and it get's more than a little uncomfortable.

snippet.title: Korean Girl Reacts to Seeing Northern Lights for First Time | Lofoten, Norway - Van Life Europe E10
snippet.description:
Finally I see the Aurora Borealis for the first time.  We went south so the skies would be darker.  It still doesn't get completely dark but much better than North Cape.  We mainly wanted to see Lofoten, one of the most beautiful spots in the world.  And since the weather had been bad, we didn't expect to see an Aurora.  But some how the skies cleared up and I saw the Northern Lights for the first time.  I even got some photos as proof with our van.

snippet.title: Big Fail into Sweet Success (TRY NOT TO LAUGH) - Van Life Europe E11
snippet.description:
Today van life travels take us out of Lofoten but still in Norway.  But the road out of Lofoten is long and winding.  So we take a short cut and hop on a ferry.  We find a beautiful campsite next to a river.  And the best part are the berries that are growing everywhere.  Lucy decides to make jam for the first time, and she finds out that making jam isn't as easy as it looks so try not to laugh. Finally we are treated to another northern lights show.  And this time the Aurora is brighter than ever.

snippet.title: Oslo is the Coolest and Why it's so hard to do Travel in Europe - Van Life Europe E14
snippet.description:
Today you favorite (hehe) Korean vanlifers travel to Oslo for the first time.  And what an amazing city.  Just wandering Oslo was a real treat.  And we saw this really cool truck from Russia.  It looks like a camper but it's really an art project.  The camper had a real wood stove in it.  Wow!  That's my dream to have a van with a wood stove.  But unfortunately it's not allowed in Korea so we won't be able to do it with Tubi... so sad.  Anyway, we really don't have the room (hehe).  I also talk about our big problem with the Schengen zone.  It's really a huge problem for us.

snippet.title: What Free Camping In Sweden Looks Like (surprising) - Van Life in Europe E15
snippet.description:
Today we are in Sweden for the first time.  And the first time we go to an official campsite for campers and RVs.  It was super nice and had everything we needed like electricity and hot showers.  But the best part.... it was all free!  

There I take a second to look at how my situation has changed since starting van life.  To me it was my diamond in my heart.  What I mean is that it's like a dream come true.  Living in a van may sound like something you do if you don't have any other choice.  But for me, it's everything I wanted.  And I'm so happy because of it.

snippet.title: 😰 Engine Problems So it's Back to Korea - Van Life in Europe E23
snippet.description:
Having a Korean van on the road has some unique problems, especially when it's a van that was only produced for a year and was only exported to two countries, Brazil and Australia.  So when we needed parts, we either have to wait for it to be shipped or once we brought them back from Korea ourselves.  Our friend BJ has a Ssangyong Musso which is not as rare in Korea, but also difficult to find outside of Korea.  So he also know the pain of trying to get repairs.

snippet.title: How We Shower in Public Places | and Montese, Italy  - Van Life in Europe E24
snippet.description:
Living in a tiny van doesn't mean we can't have a giant shower.  Normally we put up the back hatch and hang a shower curtain, but that makes it obvious that we are taking a shower.  Not a problem when your out in the woods by yourself.  But often van life takes you to places a little more public, so we came up with this idea using our awning hide what's going on behind the tarps.  

We also take a look at Montese, Italy.  It's become one of our favorite stops on this trip.  It's a hidden city high on the top of a mountain.  It has a rich history and really kind town folk that know how to welcome visitors.

snippet.title: 😭 Vanlife Repairs | We fix everything with Tape and Silicone - Episode 38
snippet.description:
Tubi is an old van and she needs a lot of TLC to keep her healthy for our long road trip crossing from Korea to Europe.  First we head to the Kia service center.  If you're keeping track, it's our third time in three cities.  Once in Mongolia and this is our second time in Russia. There are also a ton of smaller things we need to fix such as leaky windows and trim that's falling off.  So it's a couple of days of just fixing.  good thing we have the tools (lots of silicone lol) to get the job done.  We hope to explore St. Petersburg soon.

snippet.title: German Electrician built this DIY Overland Camper in just 3 Months (sad ending) - Episode 39
snippet.description:
Van life can be lonely sometimes as we might go for days without seeing or talking with other people.  But today we had a nice surprise.  Two teams of Germans became our new campsite neighbors.  On of the campers was a DIY project of a German
electrician.  This was actually his 5th build.  And wow was it nice.  Based on an Iveco Daily, it's designed for harsh overlanding conditions.  It's a real off road vehicle.

And we finally show you around St. Petersburg.  It is really really crowded, but it's also just as beautiful as everyone says it is.  We not only got to see the city, but we also met some really great new Russian friends.  But... maybe had a bit too much vodka.

snippet.title: 몽골 사람 몽골 문화의 숨겨진 진실 - 에피소드 11
snippet.description:
몽골 도착 첫날 튜비가 소금평원에 빠지면서 몽골 현지분들을 만나 도움을 받아 소금평원에서 빠져나올 수 있게 되었답니다.
튜비 캠핑카가 구출될 때까지 묵고 그리고 감빠와 함께 시간을 보내다가 묵고 몽골현지인 분의 집에 초대를 받았는데요.
몽골 사람들에게 초대를 받으면 정말 극진하게 보살펴주고 잘 돌보아준다는 말은 인터넷을 통해서 들었지만 실제로 그들과 함께 지내면서 몽골 사람들의 진실된 모습과 몽골 문화를 잘 알게 되었답니다.
몽골의 숨겨진 진실은 그들의 친절함과 인정 그리고 아낌없이 베푸는 마음이었는데요. 
이번 영상을 만들면서 지금도 묵고, 감빠 그리고 그 가족들 그리고 매일 따뜻한 포옹을 준 아기들. 제 인생에 절대로 잊지 못할 순간이랍니다. 그들이 저희에게 보여준 사랑 잊지 않고, 항상 마음에 간직할거에요. 그리고 이 영상을 보는 분들에게 전해졌으면 하네요. 
묵고, 감빠, 그리고 가족들... 보고 싶네요! 다음에 또 볼 기회가 있었으면 좋겠어요. 건강하고 우리에게 보여준 미소 그대로 간직하기를.. 바라면서 건강하고 행복하세요. 꼭 언젠가 보길 소망해봅니다.

snippet.title: 믿기지 않을만큼 아름다운 몽골 국립공원 캠핑카 여행 (보너스 엔딩 영상) - 에피소드 12
snippet.description:
몽골 도로는 생각했던 것보단 좋지 않았지만, 그 길을 따라서 몽골 국영백화점, 칭기스칸동상이 있는 곳에 튜비 캠핑카를 들고 가게 되었어요. 그리고 최종 목적지는 몽골 테릴지 국립공원 이었는데요.
몽골 현지인이 즐기는 국립공원에 도착한 첫날, 저희는 그렇게 몽골에 캠핑카를 들고 캠핑을 하게 되었답니다.
도착한 첫날 너무 아름다운 노을이 지고 있었는데요. 몽골의 아름다운 노을은 잊지 못할 장면이랍니다.

snippet.title: VAN LIFE | This goat didn't like our Campervan - Episode 16
snippet.description:
Our travel vlog in Mongolia continues, Yay!  The first video on our new English language friendly channel.  Please let us know what you think in the comments.

In this van life episode we finally make it to Dalanzadgad to fix our 12v socket and get an oil change. 

It was difficult to find a shop that would work on our van, but we finally did on the third try.  And as it turned out, the 12v sockets were just fine.  It was the splitter that we had plugged in that was blowing the fuses.  That was a little embarrassing but we are happy to be able to use the 12v sockets again.

Oh.. and we had a little run in with a goat.  I think it saw the eyes on the back of the campervan and thought it was a giant goat or something.

snippet.title: Mongolia Travel | Trekking the Valley of Vultures (Bonus Ending) - Episode 17
snippet.description:
We take our campervan into Gobi Gurvansaikhan National Park to visit Yolin-am (Yolyn am), a deep and narrow gorge in the Gurvan Saikhan Mountains of southern Mongolia. The valley is named after the Lammergeier (an old world vulture), which is called Yol in Mongolian.

This area is part of the Gobi Desert, sees little precipitation. However, Yolyn Am is famous for it's ice field that reaches several kilometers long.

At the end we try something new.  An unedited video clip of our evening.  We thought some of you might enjoy it.  Let us know in the comments.

snippet.description:

Unfortunately, our timing wasn't so good. The sandstorms from the previous two days had covered all the roads to Sevrei with a thick layer of soft fresh sand.  And that's a very unfriendly situation for a 2 wheel drive campervan. So do we make it, check out the video and find out.

snippet.title: Van Life | First river crossing.. what could go wrong? - Episode 25
snippet.description:
Today our van life adventure gets real. We cross a river.. no.. we cross rivers for the first time.  We knew overlanding Mongolia might mean a few river crossings so we studied up on it a little before we left.  Unfortunately, almost all the vehicles used were proper overland 4x4s.  So we have no idea how our rear wheel drive campervan will fair.  Because we live in our van. The idea of taking our home into a river... well you probably can understand how we feel.  But the Mongolia road trip is coming to and end... or is it?  If we can't cross the rivers, we may end up in Mongolia past our visa expiration. 

Sorry for the  extra long video.  All of this happened in one long day.  Even though we cut out a lot, it still ended up becoming a long van life documentary.  Hope you still enjoyed it.

snippet.title: VAN LIFE | This goat didn't like our Campervan - Episode 16
snippet.description:
Our travel vlog in Mongolia continues, Yay!  The first video on our new English language friendly channel.  Please let us know what you think in the comments.

In this van life episode we finally make it to Dalanzadgad to fix our 12v socket and get an oil change. 

It was difficult to find a shop that would work on our van, but we finally did on the third try.  And as it turned out, the 12v sockets were just fine.  It was the splitter that we had plugged in that was blowing the fuses.  That was a little embarrassing but we are happy to be able to use the 12v sockets again.

Oh.. and we had a little run in with a goat.  I think it saw the eyes on the back of the campervan and thought it was a giant goat or something.

snippet.title: Mongolia Travel | Trekking the Valley of Vultures (Bonus Ending) - Episode 17
snippet.description:
We take our campervan into Gobi Gurvansaikhan National Park to visit Yolin-am (Yolyn am), a deep and narrow gorge in the Gurvan Saikhan Mountains of southern Mongolia. The valley is named after the Lammergeier (an old world vulture), which is called Yol in Mongolian.

This area is part of the Gobi Desert, sees little precipitation. However, Yolyn Am is famous for it's ice field that reaches several kilometers long.

At the end we try something new.  An unedited video clip of our evening.  We thought some of you might enjoy it.  Let us know in the comments.

snippet.title: Van Life | First river crossing.. what could go wrong? - Episode 25
snippet.description:
Today our van life adventure gets real. We cross a river.. no.. we cross rivers for the first time.  We knew overlanding Mongolia might mean a few river crossings so we studied up on it a little before we left.  Unfortunately, almost all the vehicles used were proper overland 4x4s.  So we have no idea how our rear wheel drive campervan will fair.  Because we live in our van. The idea of taking our home into a river... well you probably can understand how we feel.  But the Mongolia road trip is coming to and end... or is it?  If we can't cross the rivers, we may end up in Mongolia past our visa expiration. 

Sorry for the  extra long video.  All of this happened in one long day.  Even though we cut out a lot, it still ended up becoming a long van life documentary.  Hope you still enjoyed it.

snippet.title: The Worst Thing About Van Life - Episode 33
snippet.description:
As traveling van dwellers like us, you get to experience so many amazing things.  But van life isn't always fun.  Especially saying goodbye to someone you made a real connection with.  Rinho and Vanessa are a perfect example of the bet the world has to offer.  They made a long lasting impression on us, and we are so grateful to have spend some time with them.  If you get a chance, make sure you see our interview of them on our other channel:

snippet.title: 캠핑카 내부 짐 정리 후, 블라디보스톡을 떠나 하바롭스크로 향하다. - 에피소드 3
snippet.description:
한국에서 튜비 캠핑카를 보낼 때 짐 검사 때문에,  캠핑카 내부 수납에 물건을 넣지 않고 박스 채로 그리고 가방채로 물건을 싣고 왔답니다. 러시아 친구 집에서 지내는 동안, 캠핑카 내부 짐 정리를 하고 드디어 블라디보스톡을 떠나 하바롭스크로 향하였답니다.

그리고 영상 마지막에 보면, 러시아 거주지 등록증에 대한 이야기가 있는데요. 혹시 유라시아 횡단을 준비하는 분이라면 캠핑카조아 네이버 블로그에 러시아 거주지 등록증에 대한 포스팅을 확인해 주세요.

snippet.title: 러시아 여행 |  경찰에게 잡히다..거주지 등록증까지 확인?! - 에피소드4
snippet.description:
안녕하세요 캠핑카조아 루시입니다.
러시아에 도착한지 얼마 되지 않아서, 도로에서 러시아 경찰에게 잡혔답니다. 
일단 첫번째로 언어 소통이 되지 않아서 저희가 가지고 있는 서류(자동차등록증-국문,영문, 국제면허증, 한국운전면허증)을 다 경찰에게 주었었는데요.
영상 에피소드2에서 러시아 거주지 등록증에 관련해서 영상에 짧게 담았어요. 유라시아 횡단 하시는 분이라면, 먼저 저번 에피소드 확인 해주세요. 거주지등록증에 관련해서 적은 것이 있어서 자세한 내용이 필요하다면 네이버 블로그를 확인해주세요.

snippet.title: 길에서 만난 사람들 그들은 나를 울게 만들었다 - 에피소드 5
snippet.description:
안녕하세요 캠핑카조아 루시입니다.
저번 주에 영상을 만들다가 컴퓨터가 다운이 되어서 못 올리게 되었어요. 다들 한 주 동안 잘 지내셨나요?
저흰 여전히 튜비 자작캠핑카를 타고 여행 중에 있습니다.
길을 따라 가던 중 한 커플을 만나게 되는데요. 그들은 결국 저를 울게 만들었어요. 글을 쓰는 지금도 눈물이 나려고 하네요. 
유라시아 횡단 중에 많은 사람들을 만나고 있지만, 이 커플은 제 기억에서 계속 남아 있을 것 같아요. 그리고 거주지등록증에 대해서 잘못이해해서 거주지등록증을 받기 위해서 호텔에서 숙박했답니다.

snippet.title: 몽골 사람 몽골 문화의 숨겨진 진실 - 에피소드 11
snippet.description:
몽골 도착 첫날 튜비가 소금평원에 빠지면서 몽골 현지분들을 만나 도움을 받아 소금평원에서 빠져나올 수 있게 되었답니다.
튜비 캠핑카가 구출될 때까지 묵고 그리고 감빠와 함께 시간을 보내다가 묵고 몽골현지인 분의 집에 초대를 받았는데요.
몽골 사람들에게 초대를 받으면 정말 극진하게 보살펴주고 잘 돌보아준다는 말은 인터넷을 통해서 들었지만 실제로 그들과 함께 지내면서 몽골 사람들의 진실된 모습과 몽골 문화를 잘 알게 되었답니다.
몽골의 숨겨진 진실은 그들의 친절함과 인정 그리고 아낌없이 베푸는 마음이었는데요. 
이번 영상을 만들면서 지금도 묵고, 감빠 그리고 그 가족들 그리고 매일 따뜻한 포옹을 준 아기들. 제 인생에 절대로 잊지 못할 순간이랍니다. 그들이 저희에게 보여준 사랑 잊지 않고, 항상 마음에 간직할거에요. 그리고 이 영상을 보는 분들에게 전해졌으면 하네요. 
묵고, 감빠, 그리고 가족들... 보고 싶네요! 다음에 또 볼 기회가 있었으면 좋겠어요. 건강하고 우리에게 보여준 미소 그대로 간직하기를.. 바라면서 건강하고 행복하세요. 꼭 언젠가 보길 소망해봅니다.

snippet.title: 믿기지 않을만큼 아름다운 몽골 국립공원 캠핑카 여행 (보너스 엔딩 영상) - 에피소드 12
snippet.description:
몽골 도로는 생각했던 것보단 좋지 않았지만, 그 길을 따라서 몽골 국영백화점, 칭기스칸동상이 있는 곳에 튜비 캠핑카를 들고 가게 되었어요. 그리고 최종 목적지는 몽골 테릴지 국립공원 이었는데요.
몽골 현지인이 즐기는 국립공원에 도착한 첫날, 저희는 그렇게 몽골에 캠핑카를 들고 캠핑을 하게 되었답니다.
도착한 첫날 너무 아름다운 노을이 지고 있었는데요. 몽골의 아름다운 노을은 잊지 못할 장면이랍니다.

snippet.title: 몽골 여행 | 캠핑카 여행 중 모래 폭풍에 고립 되다 - 에피소드 14
snippet.description:
안녕하세요 캠핑카조아 루시입니다.
몽골 여행 중 인터넷 사용 관련해서 울란바트로로 돌아가 재 정비 한 후 바가가질린 출루, 고비 사막으로 향하기로 했어요.
몽골 여행 중, 도로라기 보단 자동차들이 만든 트랙을 따라서  가는 캠핑카 여행이 시작 되었는데요.
캠핑 여행 중 몽골에서 모래폭풍을 만났답니다. 처음에는 그 광경이 신기해서 지켜보았었는데. 결국 모래 폭풍에 갇히게 되었답니다.

snippet.title: VAN LIFE | This goat didn't like our Campervan - Episode 16
snippet.description:
Our travel vlog in Mongolia continues, Yay!  The first video on our new English language friendly channel.  Please let us know what you think in the comments.

In this van life episode we finally make it to Dalanzadgad to fix our 12v socket and get an oil change. 

It was difficult to find a shop that would work on our van, but we finally did on the third try.  And as it turned out, the 12v sockets were just fine.  It was the splitter that we had plugged in that was blowing the fuses.  That was a little embarrassing but we are happy to be able to use the 12v sockets again.

Oh.. and we had a little run in with a goat.  I think it saw the eyes on the back of the campervan and thought it was a giant goat or something.

snippet.title: Mongolia Travel | Trekking the Valley of Vultures (Bonus Ending) - Episode 17
snippet.description:
We take our campervan into Gobi Gurvansaikhan National Park to visit Yolin-am (Yolyn am), a deep and narrow gorge in the Gurvan Saikhan Mountains of southern Mongolia. The valley is named after the Lammergeier (an old world vulture), which is called Yol in Mongolian.

This area is part of the Gobi Desert, sees little precipitation. However, Yolyn Am is famous for it's ice field that reaches several kilometers long.

At the end we try something new.  An unedited video clip of our evening.  We thought some of you might enjoy it.  Let us know in the comments.

snippet.title: VAN LIFE | Really Bad to Amazing in One Day, That's Mongolia! - Episode 18
snippet.description:
In this van life episode, we woke up to another beautiful campsite in the Mongolian steps.  After a quick breakfast, we packed up and headed into the Gobi desert to see the sand dunes.  Unfortunately, our timing wasn't so good. The sandstorms from the previous two days had covered all the roads to Sevrei with a thick layer of soft fresh sand.  And that's a very unfriendly situation for a 2 wheel drive campervan. So do we make it, check out the video and find out.

snippet.title: Van Life | First river crossing.. what could go wrong? - Episode 25
snippet.description:
Today our van life adventure gets real. We cross a river.. no.. we cross rivers for the first time.  We knew overlanding Mongolia might mean a few river crossings so we studied up on it a little before we left.  Unfortunately, almost all the vehicles used were proper overland 4x4s.  So we have no idea how our rear wheel drive campervan will fair.  Because we live in our van. The idea of taking our home into a river... well you probably can understand how we feel.  But the Mongolia road trip is coming to and end... or is it?  If we can't cross the rivers, we may end up in Mongolia past our visa expiration. 

Sorry for the  extra long video.  All of this happened in one long day.  Even though we cut out a lot, it still ended up becoming a long van life documentary.  Hope you still enjoyed it.
